sos.title: Distress Message Generator (MAYDAY)
sos.description: Follow this procedure to correctly issue a distress call on VHF Channel 16.

alert.title: Important: Before Transmitting
alert.description: Activate the DSC (Digital Selective Calling) distress button on your VHF radio if available. Then, proceed with the voice call.

step1.title: MAYDAY, MAYDAY, MAYDAY:
step1.description: The international signal for grave and imminent danger. Say it three times clearly.

step2.title: THIS IS [Ship's Name] (x3):
step2.description: Identify your vessel, repeating its name three times.

step3.title: CALL SIGN / MMSI:
step3.description: State your vessel's call sign and MMSI number for positive identification.

step4.title: MAYDAY [Ship's Name]:
step4.description: Repeat MAYDAY and your ship's name to confirm the start of the message.

step5.title: MY POSITION IS...:
step5.description: Give your position as accurately as possible (Latitude/Longitude or reference to a known point).

step6.title: I AM...:
step6.description: State the nature of the distress (e.g., 'on fire', 'sinking', 'aground', 'medical emergency').

step7.title: I REQUIRE IMMEDIATE ASSISTANCE:
step7.description: Clearly state that you need help.

step8.title: I HAVE [X] PERSONS ON BOARD:
step8.description: State the number of people on board. Crucial for rescue teams.

step9.title: OTHER INFORMATION:
step9.description: Provide any other useful information (e.g., 'abandoning ship', 'vessel is a 40-foot blue sailboat').

step10.title: OVER:
step10.description: End of transmission. Now listen for a response.

clouds.title: Cloud Types
clouds.description: Main cloud genera, classified by altitude, and their meteorological significance.

cirrus.name: Cirrus (Ci)
cirrus.description: Detached clouds in the form of white, delicate filaments or white or mostly white patches or narrow bands. Often associated with fair weather, but can indicate an approaching warm front.

cirrocumulus.name: Cirrocumulus (Cc)
cirrocumulus.description: Thin, white patch, sheet, or layer of cloud without shading, composed of very small elements in the form of grains, ripples, etc. (mackerel sky). Can indicate instability at high altitudes.

cirrostratus.name: Cirrostratus (Cs)
cirrostratus.description: Transparent, whitish cloud veil of fibrous or smooth appearance, totally or partly covering the sky, and generally producing halo phenomena. Often precedes a warm front.

altocumulus.name: Altocumulus (Ac)
altocumulus.description: White or greyish patch, sheet, or layer of cloud, generally with shading, composed of laminae, rounded masses, rolls, etc., which are sometimes partly fibrous or diffuse.

altostratus.name: Altostratus (As)
altostratus.description: Greyish or bluish cloud sheet or layer of striated, fibrous, or uniform appearance, totally or partly covering the sky. The sun or moon may be visible as if through ground glass. Often precedes continuous rain or snow.

nimbostratus.name: Nimbostratus (Ns)
nimbostratus.description: Grey cloud layer, often dark, the appearance of which is rendered diffuse by more or less continuously falling rain or snow, which in most cases reaches the ground. It is thick enough throughout to blot out the sun.

stratus.name: Stratus (St)
stratus.description: Generally grey cloud layer with a fairly uniform base, which may give drizzle, ice prisms, or snow grains. When the sun is visible through the cloud, its outline is clearly discernible.

stratocumulus.name: Stratocumulus (Sc)
stratocumulus.description: Grey or whitish patch, sheet, or layer of cloud which almost always has dark parts, composed of tessellations, rounded masses, rolls, etc. which are non-fibrous. Usually indicates stable weather.

cumulus.name: Cumulus (Cu)
cumulus.description: Detached clouds, generally dense and with sharp outlines, developing vertically in the form of rising mounds, domes, or towers, of which the bulging upper part often resembles a cauliflower. The sunlit parts are mostly brilliant white. Indicates fair weather, but can grow.

cumulonimbus.name: Cumulonimbus (Cb)
cumulonimbus.description: Heavy and dense cloud, with a considerable vertical extent, in the form of a mountain or huge towers. The upper portion is usually smooth, fibrous, or striated, and nearly always flattened (anvil). Associated with thunderstorms, heavy rain, hail, and strong winds.

purposes.port_a: Indicates the port side of a channel when returning from sea.
purposes.starboard_a: Indicates the starboard side of a channel when returning from sea.
purposes.port_b: Indicates the port side of a channel when returning from sea.
purposes.starboard_b: Indicates the starboard side of a channel when returning from sea.
purposes.north: Indicates that safe water lies to the North.
purposes.south: Indicates that safe water lies to the South.
purposes.east: Indicates that safe water lies to the East.
purposes.west: Indicates that safe water lies to the West.
purposes.isolated_danger: Erected on a danger of limited extent.
purposes.safe_water: Indicates navigable water all around the mark, such as a channel entrance.
purposes.special_mark: Indicates a special area or feature (military zone, cable, pipeline, ODAS).

mnemonics.port_a: When returning, green to starboard (green with green), red to port (red with red).
mnemonics.starboard_a: When returning, green to starboard (green with green), red to port (red with red).
mnemonics.north: Two cones pointing up (North). Continuous quick white flashing light.
mnemonics.south: Two cones pointing down (South). 6 flashes + 1 long flash.
mnemonics.east: Cones opposite by base (like an Easter egg). 3 flashes every 5s.
mnemonics.west: Cones joined by vertex (like a wine glass). 9 flashes every 10s.
mnemonics.isolated_danger: Two black spheres, two white flashes.
mnemonics.safe_water: Spherical mark with vertical stripes. White isophase, occulting, or long-flashing light.
mnemonics.special_mark: Completely yellow, with an 'X' as a topmark. Yellow light.

R23.title: Power-driven Vessel Underway
R23.explanation: Vessels under 50m may show one masthead light. Vessels under 12m may show an all-round white light and sidelights. Vessels under 7m and max speed 7 kts may show an all-round white light.

towing_gt200.title: Towing, tow > 200m
towing_gt200.description: A power-driven vessel when towing and the length of the tow exceeds 200m.
towing_gt200.explanation: The towed vessel must show sidelights and a sternlight. In an inconspicuous, partly submerged vessel is towed, it must show specific lights and marks.

towing_lt200.title: Towing, tow < 200m
towing_lt200.description: A power-driven vessel when towing and the length of the tow is less than 200m.
towing_lt200.explanation: The towed vessel must show sidelights and a sternlight.

pushing.title: Pushing Ahead or Alongside
pushing.description: A power-driven vessel when pushing ahead or towing alongside.
pushing.explanation: When pushing ahead in a composite unit, they are considered as a single power-driven vessel.

R25.title: Sailing Vessel & Under Oars
R25.explanation: May also show two all-round lights at the masthead (red over green). When under power, must show a conical shape, apex downwards.

trawling.title: Engaged in Trawling
trawling.description: Dragging a demersal or pelagic net through the water.
trawling.explanation: If making way, also shows sidelights and a sternlight. If gear extends more than 150m horizontally, a white light in that direction.

fishing_not_trawling.title: Fishing (not trawling)
fishing_not_trawling.description: Engaged in fishing with gear other than trawling.
fishing_not_trawling.explanation: If making way, also shows sidelights and a sternlight. If gear extends more than 150m horizontally, a white light in that direction.

nuc.title: Not Under Command (NUC)
nuc.description: Unable to maneuver as required by the Rules.
nuc.explanation: If making way through the water, must also exhibit sidelights and a sternlight.

ram.title: Restricted in Ability to Manoeuvre (RAM)
ram.description: Limited in her ability to manoeuvre due to the nature of her work.
ram.explanation: If making way, must also show masthead lights, sidelights and a sternlight. If at anchor, shows anchor lights instead of PDV lights.

R28.title: Vessel Constrained by Draught (CBD)
R28.description: A power-driven vessel which because of her draught in relation to the available depth of water is severely restricted in her ability to deviate from the course she is following.
R28.explanation: This signal is optional and does not grant special privileges, it serves as a warning to other vessels.

R29.title: Pilot Vessel
R29.explanation: When not on duty, shall exhibit the lights or shapes for a similar vessel of her length.

anchored.title: Vessel at Anchor
anchored.description: Vessel > 50m at anchor. May also illuminate her decks.
anchored.explanation: Vessels < 50m may show a single all-round white light. Vessels < 7m are not required to exhibit lights if not in a channel or fairway.

aground.title: Vessel Aground
aground.explanation: Must show the two all-round red lights in a vertical line, plus the lights prescribed for a vessel at anchor.

lights.masthead_aft: Second masthead light, abaft and higher than the forward one
lights.nuc_lights: Two all-round red lights in a vertical line
lights.sidelights_stern_making_way: Sidelights and a sternlight (if making way)
lights.ram_lights: Three all-round lights in a vertical line (red, white, red)
lights.pdv_lights_making_way: Masthead lights, sidelights and sternlight (if making way)
lights.cbd_lights: Three all-round red lights in a vertical line
lights.anchor_aft: All-round white light, aft and lower
lights.aground_lights: Two all-round red lights (in addition to anchor lights)

marks.trawl_mark: Two cones with their apexes together in a vertical line
marks.nuc_marks: Two balls in a vertical line
marks.ram_marks: Ball, diamond, ball in a vertical line
marks.aground_marks: Three balls in a vertical line

maneuver_stbd.title: Maneuvering to Starboard
maneuver_stbd.description: A power-driven vessel underway, when maneuvering as authorized or required by these Rules.

maneuver_port.title: Maneuvering to Port
maneuver_port.description: A power-driven vessel underway, when maneuvering as authorized or required by these Rules.

maneuver_astern.title: Operating Astern Propulsion
maneuver_astern.description: A power-driven vessel underway, when her engines are going astern.

overtake_stbd.title: Overtaking on Starboard Side
overtake_stbd.description: Intention to overtake another vessel on her starboard side.

overtake_port.title: Overtaking on Port Side
overtake_port.description: Intention to overtake another vessel on her port side.

overtake_agree.title: Agreement to be Overtaken
overtake_agree.description: Reply from the vessel to be overtaken, if in agreement.

warning_doubt.title: Warning / Doubt Signal
warning_doubt.description: When a vessel fails to understand the intentions or actions of another, or is in doubt whether sufficient action is being taken by the other to avoid collision.
warning_doubt.signal: ● ● ● ● ● (Five or more short and rapid blasts)

warning_bend.title: Warning in a Bend
warning_bend.description: A vessel nearing a bend or an area of a channel or fairway where other vessels may be obscured by an intervening obstruction.

restricted_vis_power_making_way.title: PDV, Making Way (Restricted Vis.)
restricted_vis_power_making_way.description: A power-driven vessel making way through the water in restricted visibility.

restricted_vis_power_stopped.title: PDV, Stopped (Restricted Vis.)
restricted_vis_power_stopped.description: A power-driven vessel underway but stopped and making no way through the water in restricted visibility.

restricted_vis_special.title: Special Condition Vessel (Restricted Vis.)
restricted_vis_special.description: Vessel NUC, RAM, CBD, sailing, fishing, or towing/pushing.
restricted_vis_special.signal: ▬ ● ● (One prolonged and two short blasts at intervals ≤ 2 min)

restricted_vis_towed.title: Towed Vessel (if manned) (Restricted Vis.)
restricted_vis_towed.description: The last vessel of a tow, if manned.
restricted_vis_towed.signal: ▬ ● ● ● (One prolonged and three short blasts at intervals ≤ 2 min)

restricted_vis_anchored_lt100.title: Anchored, < 100m (Restricted Vis.)
restricted_vis_anchored_lt100.description: A vessel at anchor, less than 100m in length.
restricted_vis_anchored_lt100.signal: 🔔 (Rapid ringing of the bell for 5s at intervals ≤ 1 min)

restricted_vis_anchored_gt100.title: Anchored, ≥ 100m (Restricted Vis.)
restricted_vis_anchored_gt100.description: A vessel at anchor, 100m or more in length.

restricted_vis_aground.title: Aground (Restricted Vis.)
restricted_vis_aground.signal: ●● 🔔 ●● (Two bell strokes, rapid ringing, two bell strokes)
